com.pholser.lambspec.junit

Class Assumption<S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pholser.lambspec.junit.Assumption<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - the type of object assumptions are made on

    public abstract class Assumption<S>
extends Object

    Provides a fluent interface for describing and verifying JUnit assumptions.

    Initiate assumptions on a given object using assume(Object), then chain as many conditions that the object is assumed to meet in the form of predicates to(Predicate).

      • assume

        public static <T> Assumption<T> assume(T target)
        Establishes the given object as a target for assumptions.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the assumption target
        Parameters:
        target - an object to claim assumptions against
        Returns:
        an assumption target in the fluent interface

      • to

        public final Assumption<S> to(Predicate<? super S> p)
        Establishes an assumption on the condition of the target object.
        Parameters:
        p - a predicate that represents the assumption
        Returns:
        self, so that assumptions can be chained
        Throws:
        AssumptionViolatedException - if the assumption does not hold

      • test

        protected abstract void test(Predicate<? super S> p)
        Tests the assumption represented by the given predicate.
        Parameters:
        p - a predicate that represents the assumption
        Throws:
        AssumptionViolatedException - if the assumption does not hold

      • fail

        protected void fail(String messageTemplate,
                    Object... args)
        Helper method for implementers of test(Predicate) to create an assumption failure with a particular message.
        Parameters:
        messageTemplate - a message format pattern
        args - arguments to the message template
        Throws:
        AssumptionViolatedException - always
